content: 1 The Elder to Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truth!
content_old: 1 The Elder to Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truth!

content: 2 beloved, concerning all things I desire thee to prosper, and to be in health, even as thy soul doth prosper.
content_old: 2 beloved, concerning all things I desire thee to prosper, and to be in health, even as thy soul doth prosper.

content: 3 For I rejoiced exceedingly, brethren coming and testifying of the truth in thee, even as thou in truth dost walk;
content_old: 3 For I rejoiced exceedingly, brethren coming and testifying of the truth in thee, even as thou in truth dost walk;

content: 4 greater than these things I have no joy, that I may hear of my children in truth walking.
content_old: 4 greater than these things I have no joy, that I may hear of my children in truth walking.

content: 5 Beloved, faithfully dost thou do whatever thou mayest work to the brethren and to the strangers,
content_old: 5 Beloved, faithfully dost thou do whatever thou mayest work to the brethren and to the strangers,

content: 6 who did testify of thy love before an assembly, whom thou wilt do well, having sent forward worthily of God,
content_old: 6 who did testify of thy love before an assembly, whom thou wilt do well, having sent forward worthily of God,

content: 7 because for His name they went forth, nothing receiving from the nations;
content_old: 7 because for His name they went forth, nothing receiving from the nations;

content: 8 we, then, ought to receive such, that fellow-workers we may become to the truth.
content_old: 8 we, then, ought to receive such, that fellow-workers we may become to the truth.

content: 9 I did write to the assembly, but he who is loving the first place among them—Diotrephes—doth not receive us;
content_old: 9 I did write to the assembly, but he who is loving the first place among them—Diotrephes—doth not receive us;

content: 10 because of this, if I may come, I will cause him to remember his works that he doth, with evil words prating against us; and not content with these, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and those intending he doth forbid, and out of the assembly he doth cast.
content_old: 10 because of this, if I may come, I will cause him to remember his works that he doth, with evil words prating against us; and not content with these, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and those intending he doth forbid, and out of the assembly he doth cast.

content: 11 Beloved, be not thou following that which is evil, but that which is good; he who is doing good, of God he is, and he who is doing evil hath not seen God.
content_old: 11 Beloved, be not thou following that which is evil, but that which is good; he who is doing good, of God he is, and he who is doing evil hath not seen God.

content: 12 To Demetrius testimony hath been given by all, and by the truth itself, and we also—we do testify, and ye have known that our testimony is true.
content_old: 12 To Demetrius testimony hath been given by all, and by the truth itself, and we also—we do testify, and ye have known that our testimony is true.

content: 13 Many things I had to write, but I do not wish through ink and pen to write to thee,
content_old: 13 Many things I had to write, but I do not wish through ink and pen to write to thee,
